creator: Gary_Weaver@srspos.com
text:
I've written a buildCore.xml used by multiple build.xml's and the buildCore.xml 
has the following:

<path id="project.class.path">
  ...
  <fileset dir="lib">
    <include name="**/*.jar"/>
    <include name="**/*.class"/>
  </fileset>
  ...
</path>

BUT, sometimes the lib directory does not exist, because the build.xml that is 
calling the buildCore.xml does not need one. Maybe I'm missing something, but 
it seems like there isn't a way to configure fileset not to complain in this 
situation when the directory doesn't exist.

creator: holtdl@yahoo.com
text:
Why not just put the <path> inside a target that depends on a (eg) "chkLib" 
target and have an 'if' on the property set by "chkLib"?

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
You are correct, there is no way.  And this is by design, you should probably use
soemthing like

<fileset dir=".">
  <include name="lib/**/*.jar" />
</fileset>

instead.
